result.execSummary:
The defendant Hannah K. Clement was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and stayed, with work release/huber.  0 days credit.

Conditions:

5 days conditional jail time, with work release/huber, to be served consecutively to sentence already being served.

Pay the fine and costs totaling $1505 (calculated based on a $450 base fine, plus mandated costs and surcharges including the $200 DNA surcharge).

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming required by the agent.

Obey all rules and regulations of probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.  (JOC AMENDED 5-29-15 to include the AODA language as AODA was part of the Court's order.  The Defendant has already received the written AODA Order of the Court.)

Defendant Hannah K. Clement in court, in custody, with Attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Forehand states there's a joint recommendation for 105 days on count 2 to run concurrent with Count 1. Atty McD states the def completed an AODA, made consistent payments on court obligations, and completed group sessions. Atty McD asks the court to adopt the joint recommendation. Def addresses the court. 

Court orders:

Count 2- 105 days in jail, concurrent with count one. 65 days credit. Huber is granted. Costs reduced to civil judgment.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hannah K. Clement in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution calling for def's pleas to both counts for an imposed/stayed 30 day jail sentence on the OWI 2nd charge (Count 1)for probation of 2 years with conditions to include 5 days jail (consecutive to sentence now serving) as well as fine/costs and revocation.  On count 2/resisting/obstructing charge, the agreed-upon sentence would be 2 years probation on a withheld sentence.  Atty. M states that def is indigent and asks for Court's consideration of waived fine/costs.  ADA objects, noting that fine/costs would be a condition of probation and thus, the $1505 can be paid over the course of the 2-year probation.  

Def pleads guilty to both counts.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Counsel and Def address the Court.  Sentence:  On Count 1, 30 days jail imposed/stayed for 2 years probation with conditions as follows 5 days conditional jail time to be served when def is finished serving her current sentence.  Total fine/costs of $1505, payment of that to be condition of probation.  12 mo revocation.  AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.  Count 2 - 2 years probation.  Both counts - must attend, pay for, succ. complete any treatment or programming required by agent; obey rules/regs of probation.  Clarification:  2 different sentence structures in this matter - Count 1 has imposed/stayed structure; Count 2 is sentence withheld.

Defendant Hannah K. Clement in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  NG entered.  Atty. M asks for sentencing May 27th; states she needs to be put on probation before her release from jail May 28th.  Court states possible max. penalties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
